brief_summary.textblock:
This study is based on the analysis of psychological and social questionnaires filled in by
      diabetic patients whose glycemic balance will be assessed by measuring blood levels of
      glycated haemoglobin. The aim is to compare glycemic balance by measuring HbA1c in diabetic
      patients (type 1 and 2) according to whether they have a Type A or B psychosomatic profile
      evaluated by the Bortner self-questionnaire.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  patients who have been given information about the research

          -  patients with National Health Insurance

          -  diabetic patients (type 1 or 2)

          -  patients > 18 ans

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Adult patients under guardianship or intellectually dependent

          -  patients without National Health Insurance

clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Study on the Influence of Psychosocial Variables (Stress, Type A Behaviour Pattern, Quality of Life of the Diabetic) on Glycemic Balance in Patients With Type 1 and 2 Diabetes.

oversight_info.authority: France: Agence Nationale de Sécurité du Médicament et des produits de santé

primary_outcome.measure: Correlations between glycemic balance (HbA1c) and the score on the Bortner self-questionnaire

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
